title: Quick-fried Shrimp With Sweet Toasty Garlic
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Quick-fried Shrimp With Sweet Toasty Garlic a try. Watching your figure? This gluten free, dairy free, whole 30, and pescatarian recipe has 209 calories, 32g of protein, and 6g of fat per serving. For $3.91 per serving, this recipe covers 19% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 6. 45 people found this recipe to be yummy and satisfying. A mixture of chipotle chilies en adobo, salt, flat-leaf parsley, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. To use up the olive oil you could follow this main course with the Sauteed Banana, Granolan and Yogurt Parfait as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 47 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 75%, this dish is solid. Similar recipes are Toasty Garlic Bread, Caesar Salad With Toasty Garlic Croutons, and Spaghetti with Toasty Garlic Tomato Sauce.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp works really well with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is Loveblock Pinot Gris. It has 4.6 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 24 dollars.

productMatches.title: Loveblock Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Loveblock Pinot Gris is a pale golden with hints of green. The 2013 vintage is a dry style with floral aromas and a hint of ripe pineapple. The palate reveals poached pear and blood orange, and finishes with a touch of citrus, good texture and rich mouth feel.
